text: hi everyone anthony fantano here the
internet's stuffiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of the new
crystal stilts album nature noir
crystal stilts are a new york rock band
who i've been a pretty big fan of ever
since about 2008 when i first heard
their album a light of night which in my
opinion was a pretty good spacey
trippy odd and and somewhat
off-putting psychedelic and garage rock
album i think the band hit a bit of a
creative peak in 2011 with the album in
love with oblivion which was one of my
favorite rock albums of that year still
is it's time to shake the shackles
i described this album in my review as a
pure rock and roll
nightmare lots of reverb on these
guitars very anonymous
ominous melodies and tons of energy and
just momentum coming from the tightness
of the band playing together and of
course the very deadpan low pitched and
disembodied vocals of frontman jb
townsend kind of was the cherry on top
of this whole thing the sonic variety
was much bigger than it was on their
last lp i think this was just a
fantastic album for crystal stilts they
ended up following this album up with
with a somewhat lackluster ep pretty
soon after and now they have dished out
a new full-length album which
while maybe i didn't find it as
disappointing as the ep that they
followed in love with oblivion up with
i'm not really warming up to this thing
to the point where i love it head over
heels on this album the band goes into a
decidedly
less
energetic
psychedelic and experimental direction i
would say but to what end i'm not really
sure a lot of the instrumentation on
this thing is is much more audible not
so smothered in effects but the only
thing getting rid of the effects has
exposed is is the band's incredibly
simple approach to
song and melody writing and and
performing it hasn't really added any
kind of newfound depth or revealed this
aha moment where i'm like oh crystal
stilts doesn't sound too bad without the
effects as much as i like many of the
songs from crystal stilt's previous
records
i'm not so sure how game i would be to
hear any of them acoustic or with all
the effects stripped back for me the
effects the reverb you know just the
studio trickery was a part of the fun on
tracks like electrons rising and spirit
in front of me crystal stilts are
sounding like a slightly slower and less
detailed less layered version of their
former selves one of the few tracks that
sounded actually good with some of the
effects stripped back was the song
future folklore which had this really
swagger filled guitar riff some
schmaltzy organs on this thing as well
as this floor tom bass drum beat this
song just romps it bounces around it
just has that smooth
just danceable against swagger that i
think crystal stilts should bring to the
table if they're going to strip some of
these eerie sounds back there was just
really captivating energy to this track
it kind of felt like a slightly creepy
take on a guitar riff or just a song
idea from velvet underground's white
light white heat what i think the band
really tried to do on this record is is
make an album that is not so odd or
off-putting or eerie or scary or
nightmarish but maybe put forth an album
that's a lot prettier because there are
a good handful of tracks on here that
feature
some strings some layered arranged
strings like the song star crawl or the
track memory room which is also an
acoustic ballad and the song phases
forever too which also has woodwinds in
it that sound nice the song sticks and
stones is definitely one of the more
light and airy songs that crystal stilts
have ever put together with kind of a
jangly sweet little rhythm guitar in jb
towns and kind of singing
in his higher register which does sound
odd but but in a way there is kind of a
sweetness and innocence to it and even
the title track on this lp features some
very soft rock instrumentation with this
really eerie melody that kind of creeps
in really delicately and and this kind
of delicate approach isn't really
something you usually hear on a crystal
stilts album i i think the direction
that crystal stilts are shooting for is
sounds really great on paper and i think
it sounds really great instrumentally
most of the time however i think there
are moments on this album where some of
the loose playing some of the loose and
slow playing that the band delivers like
on star crawl and
jb's vocals on pretty much every track
don't really lend themselves to the
beauty that i think they're trying to
grab for and sometimes even though the
melodies that they do employ on this
album can be kind of pretty they're not
enough they're they're they're really
too simple and too short to kind of
carry the weight of an entire track that
feels really repetitive and kind of
mundane sort of like world gone wrong
overall i did like this lp i feel like
crystal stilts have still kept their
aesthetic while trying to change and
sort of do something new for the band at
least half of the songs on this thing i
find to be really enjoyable and i have
faith that into the future maybe they'll
find a way to take some of these
beautiful melodies and more delicate
sounds and incorporate them with their
strange and odd effects or go that raw
route go that softer route but maybe
bring a little bit detail into the
process so that the songs stay engaging
from beginning to end i am feeling a
light six on this album tran position
but what did you think of this album did
you love it did you hate it why and what
do you think i should review next
anthony fantano
crystal stilts nature noir
forever
